Unusual volume of outbound data from int.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log for outbound connections to known code repository domains/IPs. Calculate outbound vs. inbound byte ratios for these connections. Flag sessions or hosts with significantly asymmetric outbound data volume, especially exceeding baselines established using historical data or statistical methods like IQR on daily outbound data volume to code repos.

Network connections to code repository s.Action: Correlate network connections (Zeek conn.log) to code repository services with process creation events (Windows Event ID 4688) on source hosts. Identify connections originating from processes or users not typically associated with software development roles or code repository interaction based on established baselines using frequency analysis. Use correlation analysis between process names/users and connection destinations/times to identify unusual pairings.

Connections to code repository services.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 5156; Zeek conn.log
Connections to code repository services.Action: Monitor process creation (Windows Event ID 4688) and network connections (Windows Event ID 5156, Zeek conn.log). Maintain a baseline of network-communicating processes per host/user using historical data. Flag connections to code repository services originating from processes that are newly observed (low frequency in historical data) or have no prior history of outbound network connections. Use frequency analysis to establish baselines and identify rare process-connection events.

Frequent or unusual 'push' or commit-lik.Data: Zeek http.log; Zeek ssl.log; Windows Event ID 4624
Frequent or unusual 'push' or commit-lik.Action: Analyze Zeek http.log and ssl.log for connections to code repository API endpoints (e.g., api.github.com, gitlab.com/api) from internal hosts. Correlate with Windows Event ID 4624 (Logon) to identify the user context on the source system. Analyze the frequency and timing of these API interactions (e.g., using time series analysis or simple counts per user/host per time period). Flag accounts or hosts exhibiting sudden spikes or unusual patterns of code repository API interaction (e.g., high frequency of POST requests to /api/vX/repos/.../git/pushes), especially outside normal working hours or from non-developer systems using descriptive statistics and thresholding.
